The RSK Group is a dynamic, multidisciplinary environmental consultancy and services provider servicing a wide range of property, manufacturing, oil, gas, and energy clients. Since 1989, our philosophy has remained the same: employ, develop and retain talented people. Working for RSK is an opportunity to evolve as a professional, to innovate and to make a difference.

Our success is founded on the talent of our employees, so we recognise the importance of personal growth, encouragement and earned rewards. As a company, we want you to share in our achievements and we want to be a conduit for your success.

Due to recent and continuing Group expansion through acquisitions, we are looking to recruit an ambitious individual to join the team to assist with the ongoing growth and challenges that RSK has set itself. This is a key hire and will provide vital day to day support to the business. We are open to applications for both full and part time hours in this role. The position will be challenging and varied giving the successful candidate a great opportunity to expand both their administrative, financial and IT systems skills.

We are now looking to recruit a Finance Analyst to work full time. This role will be based out of our Helsby Office. Currently, we are operating remote working for many of our office-based employees and this is expected to evolve into a blended working arrangement when restrictions enable this.

Finance Analyst – Helsby, Cheshire

This is a challenging opportunity where the role holder will be providing financial analysis and support to the Senior Executive Team at RSK. They will be part of an established team of Finance Analysts, working closely with Finance Business Partners and Accounts staff both centrally and within acquired companies not accounted for in Helsby. The requirements may change depending on the requirements of the Executive at the time, but will include:
  • Production of month-end financial accounts, in particular:
    • Production of Profit and Loss Accounts for companies on RSK systems, including work-in-progress adjustments
    • Many of the companies will be awaiting integration on not be on our systems, so the successful candidate will need to be able to take a Trial Balance (not necessarily complete) and integrate it into our Reporting
    • They will therefore need strong accountancy and interpersonal skills
  • Obtain and review information from the accounts systems of acquisitions to support the team integrating acquisitions
  • Work with the staff (generally accounts, but not always) to educate them as to RSK’s reporting requirements, and set up processes to meet the requirements
  • Assist with the annual processes for budgets and audits
  • Provide financial analysis and support to the Executive team as and when required
  • Identify improvements to financial processes and systems
The team also deals with other reporting such as Sales Sector Analysis, Capex Analysis, National Statistics returns, ‘Flash’ KPI reporting including entities not on our systems. The successful candidate would be involved with one or more of these.

Desired Experience

We would expect the successful candidate to hold a Chartered Accountancy qualification (ACA, CIMA or ACCA) and it is essential that the successful candidate is able to demonstrate previous experience of working in a finance position and has a good level of numeracy and literacy. The nature of the role demands candidates who are self-driven and happy working autonomously.

It would be advantageous if the candidate had prior experience of working in an international role, including liaising with local accountants and auditors. This would be either within Europe or more Globally.

Previous experience of working for an acquisitive Group or of moving accounting from one system to another would be very helpful.

Prior experience of statutory accounts production software would be advantageous but not essential.

Skills:

  • Experience of a variety of accounts systems
  • High proficiency with IT systems with advanced Excel skills
  • Personable and confident
  • Ability to self-motivate
  • Methodical and organised
  • To work to a high level of accuracy and with a keen eye for detail
  • Able to work to regular deadlines and timetables
  • Fluency in one or more European languages would be highly advantageous

Salary and benefits:

  • £commensurate with experience
  • Contributory Pension Scheme
  • Life Assurance
  • A flexible benefits programme including the option to buy additional holidays and private health care
  • Regular training and career development

For more information please email Harriet Baker, Senior HR Business Partner at hbaker@rsk.co.uk

The company prides itself on providing employees with a rewarding and challenging career, encouraging Continuous Professional Development, and enabling them to reach their full potential. Listed as being in the top 3 environmental consultancies and listed in the Sunday Times PwC Top Track 250, there has never been a more exciting time to join.

Furthermore, retaining our employees is the building block of a successful organisation and we want to ensure you maintain a healthy work life balance, with many opportunities for flexible working, social activities, and community involvement projects.

Role purpose


Provide a personal and tailored support service to people who have been a victim of crime or who have been affected by crime, to cope and recover from their experience.

Volunteers will maintain communication with victims through the cope and recovery phase of their experience. They will conduct Need Assessments to identify what the victim requires and then offer support or refer or signpost onto other appropriate agencies.

As an on-call (part-time) firefighter you will be 'on call' to respond to a range of emergencies. You can still have another job (for example, shop workers, office workers, mechanics, etc) until the call comes, then you become a professional firefighter.

On average, you could be called out two or three times a week for a couple of hours. If you can't be available all of the time it's not a problem. The Service is particularly keen to hear from people who are available during weekdays.

description: We are seeking an enthusiastic individual to support neurodevelopmental follow up on the PRECISE-DYAD study (https://wellcome.org/grant-funding/people-and-projects/grants-awarded/precise-dyad-linking-maternal-and-infant-health). PRECISE-DYAD extends the ongoing PRECISE study of pregnant women and their infants (dyads) in two sub-Saharan African countries, The Gambia and Kenya, especially after pregnancies complicated by high blood pressure, birth of a smaller-than-expected baby, stillbirth or premature birth. We aim to investigate the effect of these pregnancy complications on physical, mental health and brain development at two years of age. This post will involve working with and supporting the teams based in Kenya and Gambia as well as linking at all times to the main study group which are based between King's College London, Aga Khan University (Kenya), MRC Gambia and Vancouver, Canada. You will work under the direction of Professor Melissa Gladstone who is overseeing neurodevelopmental follow up of all children in the study. The post-holder would support; gaining ethical approval, creating standard operating procedures, piloting tools with the team and supporting trainings of assessments. You should have a PhD in psychology, medicine, early child development or a related field (occupational therapy) and have experience in conducting developmental assessments ¿ preferably with Bayley Scales or Griffiths (although could be trained if needed). You should have experience in research particularly in supporting ethics applications, protocol development. Those with field-based research or experience would be looked on favourably. You should have comprehensive IT skills including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Publisher and will need to have or gain a Good Clinical Practice certificate. The post is available for two years in the first instance but is likely to be extended to three years. We would consider those who wanted to work part-time.

description:
ARMY RESERVE SOLDIER - SERVE FROM JUST 27 DAYS A YEAR

The average person spends 15 days a year surfing the web in their spare time. With the Army Reserve, you'll get to do something different with your time. Learn new skills, make friends and get paid too.

WHAT IS THE ARMY RESERVE? - Army Reserve soldiers (Reservists) get involved in everything that the Regular Army does - from combat to peacekeeping and humanitarian work. They are given the opportunity to learn trade skills and can take advantage of the opportunities that Regular soldiers have too - like adventurous training. They are paid for the time they spend.

The difference is that Reservists are not full-time soldiers. Many Reservists have a day job.

LIFE IN THE ARMY RESERVE - Once you've joined, most Reservists serve near their home, and meet once a week to train. You'll have occasional weekends away on exercise or adventurous training.

There's also a two-week training camp that you'll go on, to put your skills into practice. You may be asked to go on operations if needed, but we will make sure that you're fully trained for the task in hand.

TRAINING TO BE A RESERVIST - As a Reservist, you do your training in the evenings and at weekends and you get paid for the time you spend training. You'll need to do your basic training - but this can be arranged to fit in around your day job. You don't have to do all the training at once. It can be completed in shorter modules or in one go.

Further training also takes place in your spare time. It can take weeks or months depending on your role, course and how much time you can give. Your unit will be happy to support you during your training.

HOW MUCH TIME WILL IT TAKE? - How much time you spend is really up to you - training is flexible and can fit around your life. Most roles will ask you to aim for 27 days a year - and your weekly training session at your unit will count towards this. To earn your annual bonus, you'll need to make sure you meet your time commitment.

BENEFITS FOR RESERVISTS - As a Reservist soldier, you'll be paid a day rate which is in line with Regular soldier pay. You can also earn a 'bounty' which is a tax-free sum, and there are financial packages available to some people looking to join the Army Reserve. You'll also be enrolled into the Armed Forces Pension Scheme.

New Entrant Daily Pay - £40.12

Soldier Daily Pay - £51.21

Bounty pay varies from £470 in year 1 to £1,862 in year 5.

It's not just about the money, you'll learn soldiering skills, but you'll also get the chance to develop more specialist skills - these could lead to gaining extra qualifications which will count outside the Army too.

We have the following roles available within this unit;

* LIGHT GUNNER - Become a highly skilled Gunner and make a big difference on the battlefield. Get qualifications, make friends for life and enjoy an exciting Army life.

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/royal-artillery/gunner-light-gunner

* ARTILLERY COMMAND SYSTEMS - Use the latest systems to get crucial information to troops. Learn about IT, get qualifications and work with people who’ll be mates for life.

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/royal-artillery/gunner-artillery-command-systems

* ARTILLERY SURVEILLANCE OBSERVER - You spot enemy units using radar. Then we lock in and destroy them – which may save many lives. Off duty, there’s an unbeatable Army lifestyle.

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/royal-artillery/gunner-artillery-surveillance-observer

* ARTILLERY LOGISTIC SPECIALIST - Could you get food, water and ammunition to troops on the battlefield? If so, you could be a key part of the Royal Artillery team.

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/royal-artillery/gunner-artillery-logistic-specialist

* CHEF - Cook for everyone from hungry soldiers in the field, to VIPs at state ceremonies. Get skilled, qualified and enjoy an incredible Army life.

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/royal-logistic-corps/chef

* COMBAT MEDICAL TECHNICIAN - Saving lives on the front line takes courage and incredible drive. We can give you support and training – the rest is up to you…

http://apply.army.mod.uk/roles/army-medical-service/combat-medical-technician

* HR SPECIALIST - Travelling the world with your unit. Getting skills and qualifications. Playing your part in a team: that’s the life of an Army HR Specialist.

description:
Looking at making a real difference in your local community? Volunteer Caseworkers are the lifeblood of SSAFA, supporting a growing number of people in need of financial, practical and emotional support. Clients come from all backgrounds and age groups and may have served in WW2 or in a more recent conflict like Iraq or Afghanistan. Our trained volunteers listen without judgement to assess and provide tailored support to help people navigate life in and beyond military service. We need you to join your local SSAFA team to help us achieve this.

Skills & Experience

  • Good listening and communication skills including written and spoken English
  • Ability to be respectful and non-judgemental with clients, their family, other agencies and SSAFA colleagues
  • Ability to send and receive emails – you will receive your own SSAFA email address
  • Ability to make enquires on behalf of clients by phone, email, letter or by filling in forms
  • Willingness to use our on-line case management system (this is covered in the caseworker training course)
  • Reliable attitude, contact clients promptly, keep appointments, update the branch regarding your availability
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and keep information safely
  • Access to public transport or a car to travel to appointments with clients
  • Able to provide two referees: former employers or other people that know you well (other than relatives)
  • Happy to be DBS checked (this is paid for by the charity)

Why volunteer with SSAFA?

  • You will attend a Three-day training course for new caseworkers. Your trainer will guide your group of like-minded volunteers through everything you need to know to get started as a SSAFA caseworker all expenses paid (During COVID-19 training is being done remotely online).
  • Some short on-line training modules to complete at home and access to a range of e-learning courses
  • Local induction and gatherings for caseworkers to meet and share ideas
  • Reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses
  • Support people in your community with a military background
  • Use your skills, knowledge and life experience to benefit others
  • Experience, training and skills that you can highlight on your CV and in job interviews
  • Better physical and mental health – studies show that volunteers live longer and experience lower levels of stress and depression!

Caseworkers visit clients to work out what type of help they need. Next, they find the right sources of support and arrange for clients to access it. This might be funds for special equipment for someone with a disability, adaptions to a property so an older client can remain at home or funds for a rental deposit. Caseworkers also sign-post clients onto specialist local services for advice on benefits, housing, mental health, debt, finding work etc.

If you want to use your time well to make a difference to SSAFA beneficiaries whilst reaping the benefits of volunteering yourself we want to hear from you.

To apply please register your interest by sending an email with your contact details and someone will be in touch.

We look forward to hearing from you.

(During COVID-19 we are completely home based and are also carrying out remote volunteer recruitment)

All action currently is remote.

Innovate Healthcare are excited to announce that we are recruiting to expand our team of Case Managers in the South.

We are passionate about two main things; people and wellbeing. In fact, our Mission and Vision revolve around both of these passions – we want to change the way the world engages with wellbeing.

With positions suitable for recent graduates, we’re looking for Sports Therapists / Exercise Scientists / Sports Rehabilitators / Physiotherapists to join us in London, Wales and the South to work as part of our growing team of Case Managers.

We pride ourselves on being a forward-thinking, preventive and holistic Vocational Health company. Our services support companies in achieving their health and wellbeing strategy as well as improving staff satisfaction, recruitment, and retention.

Purpose of the Role

The provision of fully holistic work-based assessments and completion and delivery of reports within the scope of the Access to Work programme.

Access to Work is a programme designed to assist companies with the retention of their employees who have specific health conditions and/or disabilities who may require specialist equipment, support or adaptions to their workplace environment in order to thrive within their role and the business. The programme comprises of a workplace-based assessment, followed by the compiling of a report which outlines the difficulties the client faces and the solutions to overcome any barriers to work.

Role Responsibilities

·Completing virtual and telephone-based assessments for individuals with a variety of health conditions (80%)

Travelling to and undertaking assessments in a variety of workplace environments (20%)

· Observing the client in the workplace in order to gain an understanding of the nature of the work involved in their role

· Carrying out a variety of holistic assessments and health and safety checks on the clients’ place of work

· Documenting the client’s medical condition(s)/disability, work tasks, working environment and workstation layout

· Identifying appropriate special aids/equipment, effective working practices and training necessary through the application of ergonomics in order to enable the client to maximise their productive capacity

· Researching alternative solutions to assist clients with overcoming work-related needs which occur due to health condition(s) or disability

· Advising on work organisation issues and physical changes required to the workplace environment or premises

· Working closely with administrative support to complete outcome reports including all findings and recommendations, referencing associated costs, within the agreed time frame

Skills & Experience

· Educated to degree level (Physiotherapy/Exercise Physiology/Sports Therapist/Sports Rehabilitator) (E)

· Ability to take a holistic approach to finding solutions for both client and customer (the employer) (E)

· Strong understanding of the Health & Safety at Work legislation (E)

· Ability to build strong relationships (E)

· Good time management skills; able to work with a good level of productivity in a high-volume environment (E)

· Strong organisational skills; focused on meeting SLAs (E)

· Comprehensive report-writing skills (E)

· Excellent communication skills; able to liaise with clients, employers, administrative support and specialist equipment suppliers (E)

· Ability to work well in a team as well as autonomously (E)

· IT literate (E)

· Willingness to travel (E)

· Experience of assessing medical conditions, including (but not limited to) visual and hearing impairment/learning difficulties/musculoskeletal conditions (D)

· Experience of Access to Work (D)

(E = Essential, D = Desirable)

Binnies are recruiting a Chartered Senior Geotechnical Engineer based in Chester to join or growing Water Consultancy business. The team consults, delivers and manages geotechnical engineering for Critical Human Infrastructure projects in the Water and Flood Risk Management sector for clients including The Environment Agency, Natural Resources Wales, Local Authorities, Water Utility Companies. The candidate for this role should have an aspiration to follow a technical career, and have experience in the geotechnical design of civil infrastructure schemes. The ability to travel to Client offices and project sites is essential.

Key Responsibilities

Mentor junior staff
The design and preparation of documentation for ground investigations,
Site supervision of ground investigations,
Collation and interpretation of the results of ground investigations,
Preparation of sections and drawings illustrating geological conditions,
Design of engineering solutions for earthworks, foundations, slopes and retaining structures,
Check the work of junior staff.

Qualifications/Requirements

The role is suitable for a Chartered Geotechnical Engineer (preferably through the ICE, though Geological Society and IOM3 would be considered). You should possess and be able to demonstrate the following qualifications, skills and knowledge:

Professional Qualification (CEng or CGeol)
Degree in Relevant Subject
Proven geotechnical experience within a range of sectors
Ability to mentor junior staff.
Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary team of internal professionals, and third party asset owners, stakeholders, technical officers and contractors
Motivated to work on flood and coastal risk management and water projects, experience is preferable
Experience of working on projects at appraisal, outline design, detailed design and constructions stages is preferable
Understand the importance of budget and programme control
Ability to work under time pressure and balance multiple priorities
Ability to design, plan and organise tasks
Collaborative individual that helps to build strong effective teams
Ability to liaise with internal and external clients to develop relationships across the business
Ability to effectively present technical solutions to a wide range of audiences in a variety of means
Proactive and methodical approach to problem solving as an individual and as part of a team with a desire to find a solution
Excellent attention to detail
Be driven to develop and improve your technical skills and advance your career.

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Flexible working (part time available, remote working for part of the role)
Flexible benefits e.g. buy/sell annual leave, varying pension contributions, options for private healthcare

At RSK we operate an open and relaxed management culture that nurtures continuous improvement and innovation, adopting a proactive growth strategy helps us to run a sustainable and profitable business while providing new and exciting career opportunities for all. The company prides itself on providing employees with a rewarding and challenging career, encouraging Continuous Professional Development and enabling them to reach their full potential. Listed as being in the top 3 environmental consultancies and listed in the Sunday Times PwC Top Track 250, there has never been a more exciting time to join.

Furthermore, retaining our employees is the building block of a successful organisation and we want to ensure you maintain a healthy work life balance, with many opportunities for flexible working, social activities, and community involvement projects.

RSK is also committed to our Corporate Responsibility strategy. We seek to minimise our impact on the environment; to engage positively with the community and education groups; to provide a safe and supportive atmosphere in which to work; and to promote Corporate Responsibility throughout our supply chain.

RSK Group is an Equal Opportunities Employer

Welcome to Public Health Wales the National Public Health Institute in Wales. Our purpose is Working to achieve a healthier future for Wales.

To find out more about us, please visit our homepage, read about our strategic plan or follow us on twitter.

We welcome applications from people who share our values of Working together, with trust and respect, to make a difference.

Please note that appointment may be made at Band 5 annex 21, Band 5 or Band 6 dependent on experience.

It is an exciting time to be joining Public Health Wales Microbiology as we look to dramatically expand our workforce and the way Microbiology services are delivered. Public Health Wales Microbiology consists of a network of laboratories currently based at 7 sites across Wales.

You will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of Microbiology in Wales following significant investment in new technology and staff. We aim to provide a responsive, modern, rapid diagnostic service for the people of Wales.

The North Wales Microbiology Service is seeking enthusiastic, HCPC Registered Biomedical Scientists to join our team.

To demonstrate our commitment and dedication of our staff we offer automatic progression to Band 6 on the successful completion of their IBMS Specialist Diploma (Medical Microbiology /Virology) with 100% compliance of statutory and mandatory training and relevant competency documents.

The successful post holders will be fully supported, with full training given from an established dedicated training team. You will be encouraged to develop and opportunities will be given to enhance your career.

Applications are invited from candidates who are enthusiastic, well-motivated and innovative, with good organisational and practical abilities supported by scientific knowledge. Candidates should possess well developed interpersonal and communication skills and an ability to support individual and team working.

An understanding of good laboratory practice and ISO15189 quality management is required.

Public Health Wales Microbiology North Wales is part of a network of laboratories throughout Wales. The regional service is made up of 3 laboratories, with two rapid diagnostic laboratories based in Bangor and Wrexham and a central laboratory based within Glan Clwyd Hospital. We, provide a wide range of diagnostic services to hospitals, clinics and general practitioners. The laboratory benefits from Kiestra automation, automated urinalysis and molecular testing for enteric and respiratory pathogens. The laboratory is ISO15189 accredited and approved for training purposes.

The post holder will be expected to participate in shift working, including out of hours (night shift/on call), weekends and bank holidays, to provide a 24/7 service.

Our team offers a varied, challenging and rewarding work environment, with the opportunity to be at the forefront of Microbiology in Wales.

The laboratory is based centrally on the North Wales Coast in an area of outstanding natural beauty with good main line rail and road links and easy access to coast and countryside, while also within easy reach of the cities of Chester, Liverpool and Manchester.

The ability to speak Welsh is desirable for this post; Welsh and/or English speakers are equally welcome to apply.

We are WHH an NHS Foundation Trust acknowledged as providing a positive learning environment and proud to be recognised as a Teaching Hospital. We provide first class services at Warrington Hospital, Halton General Hospital and the Cheshire and Merseyside Treatment Centre in the North West of England.

Our mission is to be Outstanding for our patients, our communities and each other.

We pride ourselves in being consciously inclusive and enjoy working with and for the diverse community we serve, employing a high calibre of skilled staff, reflective of our communities.

Our vision is to continue to deliver high quality, safe and sustainable health and care services to the local population of Warrington, Halton and beyond. Our approach to healthcare is founded on our five core values; Working Together, Excellence, Accountable, Role Models and Embracing Change.

As an applicant or employee of WHH you have our commitment to equality, diversity and inclusion, it’s the way we work! Our beliefs and culture insist that no job applicant or employee will receive less favourable treatment from the start of the employment journey.

Working at WHH means joining a team of 4,000+ professional and support staff who local people look to, to keep them well and support their well-being. If you embrace these values and are motivated to making a difference to our patients, we'll look forward to receiving your application.

Department of Radiology

Experienced Cross-Sectional Radiographers– Band 6 – Training Supported

Full Time & Part Time Hours Available

We are looking for Amazing Radiographers with MRI or CT experience, who are interested in career progression and advanced practice.

We are the ‘hidden-gem’ of the North-West and are at an extremely exciting phase in our Radiology department expansion programme. If you want to further your career, this department is a perfect place for you!

We have plenty of opportunities for CPD including research, audits, CPD meetings, and spending time in other imaging modalities. So come and join a dynamic and exciting department, where we are committed to supporting and encouraging our staff.

The successful candidates will gain experience working with the Cross Sectional Imaging team on our 2 CT scanners & 2 1.5T MRI scanners on the Warrington site. In April 2020, we installed the UK’s first 640 slice Canon Aquilion One PRISM CT scanner and are now a reference site for Canon. We also have a 128 slice CT scanner & 3T MRI scanner in the Captain Sir Tom Moore Centre on the Halton site.

Our department expansion and equipment replacement programme continues this year with the build and installation of a new Siemens 1.5T Sola as a 2nd MRI scanner on the Warrington site in March 2021, doubling the size of our MRI suite, allowing us to introduce cardiac MRI and scanning patients under GA. We have recently completed a build project to double the footprint of our CT department, providing separate Inpatient and Outpatient entrances, highlighting our high standards in patient-centered care.

As a Radiology department, we support Radiographer Chest/Abdomen/MSK/ Nuclear Medicine reporting, Radiographer-Led CT Colonography, and Mammography & Interventional Advanced Practice. We also support 2 Radiographers each year to travel to Chicago to RSNA to enhance the high standard of service we deliver to our patients.

All of our Band 6 CT radiographers are trained to do CT Colonography and Cardiac Imaging. Our Band 6 MRI radiographers are trained in breast imaging and we will be developing our Cardiac MRI service, with the arrival of the new scanner.

Our CT out of hours cover is a resident on-call system with lucrative payments and generous rest time attached. We do not operate an MRI on call system. Due to the COVID backlog of cases we have lots of opportunity for voluntary overtime.

We care for our patients across three sites situated within close commuting distance from one another which provide a range of clinical experiences for our staff.

We support new staff by ensuring they are on a mentorship programme to support their transition to our Trust, ensuring that you will feel confident and competent in your role.

These roles are an exceptional opportunity for a committed professional with excellent interpersonal skills to further develop their experience in a supportive environment within a forward thinking Trust.

description:
*Overall Role description
The Nursery Executive Group Manager (NEGM) will be expected to:

  • Oversee the operation of the Parkland Partnership as the charity and its subsidiary Parklands Private Day Nursery Ltd and the three associated nurseries to the highest standards, ensuring that the best possible environment and care are provided for young children.
  • Act as the Companies’ Secretary to ensure all official documents are filled on time and ensure total compliance with Companies House, Charities Commission, HMRC etc requirements
  • Act as the Ofsted Nominated Individual reporting to the Responsible Individuals (Board Members) and representing them and the Responsible Persons (the two companies) to Ofsted
  • Ensure nurseries perform to achieve agreed targets including financial and other KPIs
  • Identify opportunities to develop and strengthen the business performance.
  • Nurture a drive in each manager and setting to be the very best, achieve excellence and continuous improvement with the goal of all settings becoming outstanding.
  • Ensure and assure high quality, flexible childcare for families from the local communities where Parkland Partnership and associated companies have nurseries.
  • To ensure all nurseries within Parkland Partnership’s portfolio are aware of the ethical responsibilities of being a charity whilst maintaining long term sustainability, including achieving financial targets, managing operating costs and ensuring viability.
  • Marketing- Social Media, Instagram, Website. Ensuring the enquiry manager is used on Kindersoft.

*
Main Responsibilities are to: Ensure high standards of care and education of children between 0 to five years (and for older children in afterschool or holiday club where that is offered none presently due to COVID bubbles) within the nurseries including regular monitoring and weekly visits and spot checks in order to ensure compliance with statutory requirements (EYFS, Charity Commission and Companies Act as well as HMRC requirements) and positive reports from all regulatory and other quality assurance inspections.

  • To ensure nursery sustainability and achieve optimum occupancy.
  • Develop a strong sense of responsibility in managers to fully manage and control their own settings as if they were their own. To consult with with the NEGM but not delegate matters to the NEGM.
  • Be an effective member of the Executive Management Team and Group Management Team, positively promote Parkland Partnership and associated companies, and contribute to the strategic planning, monitoring, evaluation and development of Parkland Partnership nurseries.
  • To maintain a good level of communication across all personnel and, where relevant, update the Board occurrences within the nurseries.
  • To offer specialist advice and expertise on early years practice and standards to Group Management Team and each nursery’s Senior Management Team, individual nursery managers and nursery staff.
  • To monitor all personnel within the nurseries to ensure there is a high level of awareness of company policies and procedures and a positive motivating environment.
  • To keep updated on any changes in legislation and/or new initiatives and implement them within nursery settings in a way that manages change effectively.
  • To continually reflect on and improve practice in order to ensure the best possible care and education are offered within all settings.
  • To support the managers to deal promptly and professionally with any queries, concerns or complaints from any parents and carers or neighbours and take action as necessary.
  • Continuous improvement though self assessment and effective planning with clear plans in place for each setting.
  • Oversee /coordinate with Finance Manager all higher-level management functions e.g. insurance renewals and claims, utilities contracts etc.

*
Nursery Management/Administration

  • * Finance overseeing the budgets
  • Recruit, train and support Nursery Managers in order to foster good morale, high reputation and ensure all regulatory standards are met.
  • Promote the continued improvement of all the nurseries through contribution to the monthly management meetings and other management forums.
  • Management, supervision and appraisal of Nursery Managers including identifying training needs and facilitating training opportunities.
  • To coach, mentor, develop, support, guide and assist the Nursery Managers in any matters concerning the day to day running of their nurseries.
  • Actively manage, improve and report back to the Board on current nursery occupancy and six monthly future forecasting.
  • Carry out and record agreed visits at least once per week including spot checks and monthly extended visits at each site and feed back to the Board Chairman.
  • Ensure the environment at all sites fosters social inclusion and acceptance of all children, social and educational stimulation through curriculum based experiences, which are age and stage appropriate.
  • Oversee Nursery Policies including Safeguarding, Equal Opportunities, Data Protection and Confidentiality and work with the Directors on updating, changing or implementing new policies.
  • To liaise with the managers to ensure the nurseries’ waiting lists are managed effectively.
  • To market the nursery effectively and seek new products and opportunities to grow the business.
  • Develop, manage and monitor quality systems.
  • To advise on ways to improve business efficiency and lead projects as needed to deliver these improvements.

Health and Safety * Ensure the safety and well being of all children in the nursery’s care resulting in the total avoidance of preventable accidents and promoting a feeling of security and satisfaction amongst all parents.

  • Implement all company health and safety procedures to ensure the well being of children and staff in relation to staff, buildings and resources.
  • Ensure high quality risk assessments are carried out to prevent accidents among children, staff, parents and others persons entering the premises.
  • Ensure a high level of hygiene is maintained, by staff cleaning and sterilising of equipment and recording information as evidence.
  • To monitor drills and other checks take place as per policy and legislation.
  • To monitor that accidents within the establishment are recorded appropriately in accident books and information relayed to parents.
  • Understand and implement Policies and Procedures (for example Health and Safety)

Personnel * The NEGM reports to the Board and manages nursery managers and teachers where appropriate.

  • Support Nursery Managers in recruitment at senior levels and ensure that they take full ownership of all stages of recruitment.
  • To liaise with the Managers (using one from another setting as required) regarding any disciplinary, grievance or capability matters and conduct such procedures as necessary.
  • To work in conjunction with Nursery Managers in identifying and arranging relevant training for the staff.
  • Assist the managers with any concerns about their staff.
  • Complete annual appraisals on Nursery Managers. (Regular supervisions and one to ones)
  • To work with the Nursery Managers in ensuring staffing levels are correct and liaise with relevant bodies regarding advertising, interviewing and recruiting.
  • To monitor staff personnel forms and identify training needs or gaps. (The managers need to take this responsibility and yes over see)

*
Communication To report back all information regarding the nurseries to the Board through regular meetings and monthly work plans.

  • To ensure all staff follow company procedures for daily communications to and from parents.
  • Maintain effective internal communication, team meetings (GMT, Nursery SMTs, JMTs and whole MTs), and a system of monthly staff professional supervision which continually monitors the impact of training, support and new initiatives.
  • The NEGM will be expected to build good working relationships at every level and ensure effective communication between the nursery staff and all partner organisations (internal and external – see below):

Internal

  • Board / Chairman of Board
  • All staff employed by the nurseries
  • Between nursery managers to ensure learning and synergy are developed
  • Children
  • Coordinating and chairing Senior Management Team meetings when necessary.

External

  • Ofsted
  • Local Authority Early Years Teams & LADO
  • Parents and families
  • Community
  • Staff from a wide range of other agencies and settings, including the Social Services, Education and schools, Primary Care Trust, NHS Trust, Surestart and a range of voluntary / private sector organisations and Day Care providers.

Decision making * Information and guidance will be readily available, however, the NEGM will be expected to work autonomously in relation to the day to day management of nurseries. The role requires the confidence to make day to day decisions thoughtfully and with a high degree of sensitivity to the needs of staff, children and families. (This is good,it needs to be clear with the managers prior to this person starting that decisions will be made going forward and they will have to deal with it as you have gone)

  • The NEGM will be expected to make recommendations and proposals about service developments and changes,
  • Decisions made by the NEGM will directly impact on the day to day quality, availability and flexibility nursery provision for children and families. I think these are good points however, if a decision is made I believe you will have to go with it
  • The NEGM will exercise discretion about which families may receive a service (in line with the Admissions Policy), and will be expected to interpret Policies and Procedures thoughtfully, consistently and tactfully.
  • The NEGM will be responsible to review prices in addition to the automatic increase as per the Low Pay Commission as needed, including sole discretion on promotions provided budgets are adhered to at all times or by exception with agreement of the Board
  • Executive Aspects
  • To Liaise with the bank if required regarding any bank accounts and/or liabilities as well as nursery performance as needed.
  • To review and sign all contracts at all times ensuring suitability and budgets are maintained
  • To review insurance each year, secure renewal quotes and ensure comprehensive cover is maintained at all times.
  • To handle any Claims on insurance as required
  • Oversee the COVID procedures at each setting to ensure the entire organisation is COVID secure.
  • To work with the Finance Clerk to ensure accurate Management Information and Annual Accounts for the Board and the banks as required.
  • To authorise all transactions that depart the bank including payroll payments each month.
  • To countersign cheques and credit card applications and anything else as required.

*
*Person SpecificationKnowledge and Skills

  • Strong knowledge, understanding and practical experience of a range of Day Care settings for young children.
  • Knowledge and practical understanding of child development and parenting.
  • High level knowledge and understanding of legislation and regulations relating to day care for young children and the inspections process for approval of day care settings including EYFS.
  • Knowledge and ability to create and implement policies and procedures consistent with legislation, regulations and local requirements.
  • Able to work independently and to manage own time efficiently.
  • Experience of managing, supervision and appraisal of staff.
  • Ability to lead by example and model expected standards of behaviour.
  • Ability to develop an effective team.
  • Ability to create and implement basic systems for child records and financial records.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with staff at all levels.
  • Commitment to equal opportunities for all staff, children and families.
  • Understanding of quality assurance and associated systems
  • Experience of running the business as well as just the nursery operation is key to this role
  • Experience of running a limited company is desirable.

Qualifications and Experience

  • Degree in a suitable EY area of study or EYPS or be working towards achievement
  • Management and safeguarding qualifications
  • SENCO qualification and experience
  • Numeracy and Literacy skills equivalent to NVQ level 3
  • ICT literate
  • Three years post qualifying experience of working in a management capacity of which three years have been in an EY setting
  • Knowledge of the Foundation Stage curriculum
  • Knowledge, understanding and practical experience working in a nursery, child development and parenting of young children
  • Knowledge of relevant legislation, best practice and the inspection process of nurseries
  • Desirable – teaching qualification such as QTS.

*

*
Other Duties

The duties and responsibilities in this job description are not restrictive and the post holder may be required to undertake any other duties which may be required from time to time. Any such duties should not, however, substantially change the general character of the post.

Equal Opportunities

The post holder must carry out his/her duties with full regard to the setting’s Equal Opportunities Policy, Quality and Inclusion as well as Health and Safety.

Healthy living approach a must as is experience in sales. This post would suit someone with sports therapy/massage therapy/ physiotherapy experience.

Job Purpose

Admin Assistant:

Providing the first point of contact with the practice for all patients, callers and other visitors, ensuring they receive a friendly welcome and the service they require. Ensuring the smooth running of the reception and administrative functions of the practice. Providing administrative and clerical support to the clinical staff and other members of the practice team.

Chiropractic Rehab Assistant:

The role of the chiropractic assistant is to work alongside the chiropractor and front of house team to provide an exceptional customer experience. While working alongside the chiropractor you will provide a multidisciplinary combined approach which may include soft tissue work, stretching, rehabilitation and advice. It is vital that we maintain excellent time keeping for the smooth running of the practice and patient satisfaction. You will also be tasked with confirming care plan frequency with patients, when their next appointment is, if they fully understand their plans of care and if they have any other requirements.

All tasks should be carried out in accordance with practice policies and procedures. We have a training manual and scripts that are a necessity to learn.

Reception:

Meet and greet patients at the front desk, providing a friendly and helpful welcome. Respond to patients’ questions, queries and requests at the front desk and by telephone and by email. Take messages for other members of the team and ensure they receive and act on these. Make appointments over the telephone, by email or in person. Schedule future appointments for patients. Handle requests for emergency appointments and consultations. Register new patients and handle changes to patient information. Input patient data to the practice computer system. Take card and cash payments for patient treatments and balance banking at the end of the day. Make calls to prospective patients using our CRM. Ensure the practice is immaculately clean and tidy. Open and close the practice at the start and end of the day, if first to arrive and/or last to leave.

Chiropractic Assistant:

Meet and greet patients with a friendly and professional manner Respond to patients’ questions, queries and requests. Liaise with Chiropractor and other team members. Provide general support to the Chiropractor. Provide the complete care package and liaise with Chiropractor. Provide safe and effective treatment advised by the Chiropractor. Attends to patient needs, and ensures the Chiropractor runs to time. Assist during patient examinations. Takes some general diagnostic information including blood pressure, weight, and height and records this for the Chiropractor to use in the examination and care programme. Provide assistance to the Chiropractor with therapies, procedures and patient handling. Educate patients on importance of engaging in chiropractic care. Provides patients with information about Chiropractic care and how to get the best out of their care. Ensure the general hygiene, maintenance and smooth operation of the practice and relevant materials and equipment. Check stock and place orders when necessary. Ensure equipment in clean and in working order. Maintain cleanliness of the rooms and general tidiness of the workplace. Attend regular team meetings to problem solve and promote efficiency. Ensure insurance is up to date. Participate in Continued Professional Development. Collaborate and launch new ideas, products, services, and promote them accordingly. Work with other members of the team.

There is potentially an opportunity to work as an employed massage therapist within the practice also with a different pay structure.

On average, you could be called out two or three times a week for a couple of hours. If you can't be available all of the time it's not a problem. The Service is particularly keen to hear from people who are available during weekdays.

Find out more about the role of an on-call firefighter

What qualities do I need?

On-call/part-time firefighters come from every walk of life, including shopkeepers, builders, plumbers, farmers, secretaries, engineers and directors of companies, together with people who are not currently employed. Previous experience is not required thanks to the comprehensive training programme.

You must be able to get to Birchwood Fire Station quickly after being alerted by a bleeper.

This role can be physically demanding and therefore physical fitness is very important.

We’re looking for an Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Business Partner to help us with an exciting and wide-ranging Equality, Diversity and Inclusion (ED&I) initiatives. This is a part time position, with the successful candidate working 3 days a week.

This is a rare opportunity to help influence and shape the future ED&I plans and agenda of our unique organisation: we’re part of the Virgin Group as well as an important provider of NHS services.

In this role you’ll review how representative our workforce is of the communities they serve, design the scope and content of the next stage of our ED&I activities including our learning and development offering, develop a plan to expand our colleague voice networks and design a proposed EDI strategy, policy and action plan.

Whilst your base-office would be the Heath Business and Technical Park in Runcorn, we are currently working from home due to COVID-19. This is a flexible position, so we’re happy to consider candidates from across the UK.

Feel Valued

You will receive a competitive salary of up to £35,000 per annum full time equivalent, dependant on experience, 25 days holiday plus bank holidays (pro rata equivalent will apply), group pension, private medical insurance and access to a life assurance scheme, as well as a range of other benefits included within Virgin Tribe. Virgin Tribe grants you access to exclusive offers, such as competitions, and discounts on experience days, high street stores, cinema tickets and holidays! This is in addition to all the usual NHS discounts.

You will have a committed Learning and Development team, where you will be offered a suite of courses and opportunities to further your potential and support your career progression.

You’ll really feel the difference as you’ll have access to our online health and lifestyle platform covering healthy recipes, activity challenges, and support information around both physical and mental health.

We’re looking for a highly motivated, driven individual with a passion for ED&I. You will be knowledgeable within ED&I matters (including the legal framework and emerging best practice) and will have excellent analytical skills, including the ability to delve into the detail whilst also being able to see and tell the broader story. You’ll be personable, able to build effective relationships quickly (including remotely) and be skilled in influencing a broad range of stakeholders on ED&I matters. Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must, as is a high level of personal resilience.

Whilst not a requirement, prior healthcare experience could be a bonus.

A key element of the role will be developing an action plan to help influence the next ED&I activity over the coming 18-24 months, so it’s crucial you have a practical mindset and the ability to prioritise (and articulate) activity in a logical and sequential way.

You will be joining a small but knowledgeable and friendly Reward, Wellbeing and ED&I team who will be on hand to support your induction as you settle into life at Virgin Care. Things can change at the drop of a hat, so your flexibility is key and no two days are the same but that’s what we love about working here. If this sounds like an environment you would thrive in, and a project which sparks your interest, we can’t wait to hear from you.

Feel Inspired

Here at Virgin Care, colleague recognition is important to us and we know that across our services there are colleagues who deserve acknowledgment for their commitment for going above and beyond to ensure that their colleagues and service users feel the difference. Every year we hold Feel the Difference Awards were nominated colleagues get together for a celebration to receive their prize for their recognised hard work as well as all of the team events and awards throughout the year.

Next steps

Feel the difference

We partner with the NHS to make a real difference to people and we’re building a working environment where colleagues too can really feel the difference. It’s the kind of place where nothing’s too much trouble. Where you’ll feel empowered, listened to, valued and where we’ll support you to bring your best self to work every single day and to deliver high quality care. And that’s just the beginning. Since 2006, we’ve delivered services to millions of people by developing our own unique approach where our patients are at the centre of everything we do.

We are seeking to recruit two new members to join our dynamic, friendly nursing team at Paxton Medical Group. We are a growing practice serving a population of over 15,000 patients across two sites; Claughton and Fender Way.

You will be working in an experienced, well established nursing team within a training practice. We would like to recruit someone with qualifications and experience in chronic disease management, particularly diabetes and respiratory conditions. The ideal candidate would also have experience performing cervical screening and routine immunisations.

Hours are negotiable. Salary is negotiable depending on skills and experience.

ONLY SUCCESSFUL APPLICANTS WILL BE CONTACTED.

Job Description:

To provide and maintain a high standard of nursing care for patients as well as providing nursing assistance to the doctors and other members of the primary healthcare team. Clinically, the focus of the role is the delivery of evidence-based practice for patients with chronic conditions. Duties will include all tasks normally undertaken by an experienced RGN and in addition any roles agreed between the nurse and the doctors as appropriate.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Professional:

1. Proactively assess, plan, implement and evaluate individualised treatment plans for patients with chronic conditions including asthma, COPD and diabetes.

2. Implementation of evidence based practice in-line with national and local guidelines.

3. Ability to accurately perform and interpret spirometry in-line with ARTP standards

4. Running well person clinics and health promotion programmes by providing holistic assessment and lifestyle advice on diet, smoking, alcohol intake and exercise, with referral to appropriate agencies.

5. Review medication for therapeutic effectiveness, appropriate to patient needs and in accordance with evidence-based practice and national and practice protocols.

6. Work with patients in order to support adherence to prescribed treatments. Provide information and advice on prescribed or over-the-counter medication on medication regimens, side-effects and interactions.

7. Prioritise health problems and intervene appropriately to assist the patient in complex, urgent or emergency situations, including initiation of effective emergency care.

8. Implement and participate in vaccination and immunisation programmes for both adults and children.

9. Advise, support and, where appropriate, administer vaccinations for

patients travelling abroad.

10. Perform cervical cytology tests in line with current policies and procedures

11. Perform venepuncture according to local guidelines

12. Provide a holistic approach to wound management and implement wound care in line with current evidence based guidelines, and locally agreed formulary.

13. Suture removal

14. Perform Electrocardiograms - ECG

15. Undertake Ear Care

16. Perform pill checks and offer contraceptive advice / support

17. Ability to perform INR checks using point of care testing and use of INR star software to record data / guide treatment decisions

18. Able to recognize and manage anaphylaxis according to current UK guidelines

19. Able to perform Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation according to current UK guidelines. Updates regularly provided

21. Ability to obtain and document informed consent (either verbal or written).

22. Ensure infection control guidelines are maintained.

23. Ability to monitor and manage maintenance of stock and equipment to include: Refrigeration, single use equipment and general treatment room and emergency equipment.

24. Confidentiality of information gained at work must be preserved at all times

25. Able to document Consultations according to NMC guidelines

Management of Chronic Disease:

26. Ability to run agreed protocols in all chronic disease patients within a primary care setting. To include: 1. COPD/Asthma 2. Diabetes 3. Hypertension 4. Heart Disease 5. Coagulation Monitoring with Warfarin

27. Diagnosis, monitoring and development of individual management plans; agreeing these as appropriate with the patient and other health professional

28. Checking compliance with and adherence to appropriate treatments using an holistic patient-centred approach

29. Recognising abnormalities

General:

30. Contribute to the assessment of service needs

31. Assist patients to identify their health needs.

32. Contribute a nursing perspective to the Practice development plan.

33. Manage and organise individual patient consultations.

34. Ensure effective relationships and communications with the PCT and other agencies.

35. Support the Practice clinical governance agenda.

Educational:

36. Identify personal development and training needs in conjunction with the partners and Practice Manager.

37. To participate in continuing education and maintain a contemporary level professional knowledge and skills.

Confidentiality:

38. In the course of seeking treatment, patients entrust us with, or allow us to gather sensitive information in relation to their health and other matters. They do so in confidence and have the right to expect that staff will respect their privacy and act appropriately In the performance of the duties outlined in this job description, the post holder may have access to confidential information relating to patients and their carers, Practice staff and other healthcare workers. They may also have access to information relating to the Practice as a business organisation. All such information from any source is to be regarded as strictly confidential. Information relating to patients, carers, colleagues, other healthcare workers of the business of the Practice may only be divulged to authorised persons in accordance with the Practice policies and procedures relating to confidentiality and the protection of personal sensitive data

Health & Safety:

39. The post-holder will assist in promoting and maintaining their own and others’ health, safety and security as defined in the Practice Health and Safety Policy, to include: Using personal security systems within the workplace according to Practice guidelines Identifying the risks involved in work activities and undertaking such activities in a way that manages those risks Making effective use of training to update knowledge and skills Using appropriate infection control procedures, maintaining work areas in a tidy and safe way free from hazards Reporting any potential risk that are identified

Equality and Diversity:

40. The post holder will support the equality, diversity and rights of patients, carers and colleagues, to include: Acting in a way that recognises the importance of people’s rights, interpreting them in a way that is consistent with Practice procedures and policies, and current legislation Respecting the privacy, dignity, needs and beliefs of patients, carers and colleagues Behaving in a manner which is welcoming to and of the individual, is non-judgmental and respects their circumstances, feelings priorities and rights.

Personal/Professional

Development:

41. The post holder will participate in any training programme implemented by the practice as part of this employment, such training to include: Participation in an annual individual performance review, including taking responsibility for maintaining a record of own personal and/ or professional development.

Quality:

42. The post holder will strive to maintain quality within the Practice, and will: Alert other team members to issues of quality and risk Assess own performance and take accountability for own actions, either directly or under supervision Make suggestions on ways to improve and enhance the team’s performance Work effectively with individuals in other agencies to meet patient’s needs Effectively manage own time, workload and resources

Communication:

43. Demonstrate sensitive communication styles to ensure patients are fully informed and consent to treatment

44. Support patients who are receiving ‘bad news’

45. Participate in practice/team meetings, as required

This job description is not exhaustive and may be adjusted periodically after review and consultation. You will also be expected to carry out any reasonable additional duties which may be requested from time-to-time.

Save the Family are Recruiting for 2 Part-time Outreach Mentors

Are you an excellent mentor?
Do you have excellent empathy with the needs of vulnerable families?
Are you able to empower individuals?
Do you have a flexible can-do approach to problem-solving?

Then you may be interested in the following role at Save the Family.

Part-time Family Mentor
Salary: £18,200 per annum (pro rata)
Benefits: Contributory healthcare plan and pension
Hours of work: 21 hours per week.
Flexibility is required for this position, as hours may change depending on the needs of our residents.
Location: Just outside Chester.

The Outreach Mentor Role

We have 2 part-time vacancies, for additional Outreach Mentors, to work within our Outreach Project which is funded by The National Lottery.

The aim of the project is to ensure there is a seamless transition for families when they are ready to move back into the community from our residential site. The Outreach Mentor will work closely with our on-site Mentoring team to plan for positive move on and will then work with families in the community to ensure they settle positively.

This role brings an exciting opportunity to help set up, shape and deliver this fantastic new service. Applicants should have experience of working within a mentoring role, ideally in a families community setting and experience of working with vulnerable people addressing issues such as domestic violence, mental health, addiction and debt.

You will have empathy with the need of vulnerable families, and the proactivity and positivity to help them successfully live independently. Alongside this you will have the confidence to represent the charity with key partners and build new community networks. Knowledge and experience of good safeguarding practice is also critically important as well as the ability to lone work and think on your feet.

This role is 21 hours per week and may involve some evening and weekend working.

This position is funded by the National Lottery.

About Save the Family

Save the Family is a charity based in Cheshire. We provide a safe community environment combined with tailored mentoring to homeless and vulnerable families. The help offered includes access to training, employment support and issue led support enabling families to get back on their feet and move forward with confidence.

Family Mentoring Approach
Save the Family provides a safe residential community for homeless and troubled families where safeguarding is paramount. We aim to keep families together and help them create a positive future through our unique Family Mentoring approach.

Family Mentoring means that as family role models we develop a relationship based on trust, appropriate challenge, guidance and empowerment with families, which enables them to identify and overcome barriers, become independent and reach their true potential.

Our approach to mentoring is both person and family-centred, demonstrating empathy, maturity and mutual respect, so that we can help individuals and whole families to develop resilience and a positive attitude towards education, social and life skills, relationships, health, work and essential routines. The methodology is based on showing by example and empowering the family to live as a cohesive unit.

At Save the Family, mentoring provides non-judgemental emotional support, guidance and a sense of continuity and stability, which may otherwise be missing in the lives of individuals.
Through successful mentoring families develop essential social skills, recognise their own strengths and self-worth grow in confidence and overcome their difficulties.

For more information about these positions, please visit the jobs page of our website where you will find a downloadable job description (including person specification): http://www.savethefamily.org.uk/workforus/
To apply for a position: Please send CV and covering letter, detailing how you meet the essential criteria, as detailed in the person specification. Please note, applicants who do not demonstrate that they meet the essential criteria for a role will not be considered for a position. Candidates must also demonstrate both at the application stage and interview that they are able to positively identify with Save the Family’s values. We would be grateful if all applicants could fill in our equality and diversity monitoring form, which can be downloaded via our website link above.

CLOSING DATE FOR APPLICATIONS: 5:00pm Tuesday 6th April 2021

Safeguarding and equal opportunities
Save the Family is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment, therefore an Enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) (previously known as CRB) check is required with this post.

The job offer will also be subject to two satisfactory references. References should be from employers, or ex-employers. Family member references are not acceptable. If the role involves working with children, at least one reference from a previous employer where the role involved working with children should be provided.

Save the Family is an equal opportunities employer.

The role

If you are interested in amazing job satisfaction then we just might have the role for you. We are looking for a mature person to work part time with some of the people we support in Cronton and Halewood

We are currently looking for a person that has patience and great organisational skills, to provide the nurturing support that is going to help people to blossom and succeed.

Vocational Support Service

Vocational Support Workers experience an incredibly rewarding and fulfilling role. Our Vocational Support Workers empower people with support needs to be successful in the job they love.

We want to hear from caring, enthusiastic and dedicated team players with a can-do approach who, as a Vocational Support Worker, will be committed to support people to have a great work life through innovative person centred support.

As a Vocational Support Worker you will be matched with people to support them to find or attend work, providing one to one support in the workplace to help the person achieve SMART targets and increase in independence.

Vocational Support is Community Integrated Care’s Northwest based supported employment service, assisting people with learning disabilities, mental health concerns and autism to access employment and vocational training.

Our service supports people across Liverpool, Merseyside, Knowsley, St. Helens and Halton to find the right job for them by:-

  • identifying their individual skills, interests, aspirations and goals;
  • matching people with like-minded Vocational Support Workers;
  • finding the right vocational training and qualifications;
  • helping find work experience and job taster placements;
  • offering on-going support throughout their employment.

We work closely with lots of different types of employers, seeking a wide range of job roles which offer the people we support a real opportunity to become valued and integrated team members. The people we support are able to make a genuine and positive contribution to their workplace, enjoying the sense of empowerment, independence and achievement which working brings.

We are proud to deliver placements with the likes of McDonalds, Everton in the Community, Bluecoat, Tesco and the RFLWC. The people we support work in a variety of roles from Admin, front of house, parks and gardens, fast food, factories, sports coaching and charity shops.

About You

About you

Our ideal Support Worker will be:

  • Self-motivated with energy and drive
  • Able to work autonomously and as part of a team.
  • Reliable, friendly and caring to support the people we support to achieve their everyday goals (including personal care)
  • Able to support people to travel on public transport and in a variety of workplaces
  • Confident and inspire the person we support to achieve more
  • Able to help manage some behaviours that may challenge the norm – we provide training and guidance to enable you to do this
  • Comfortable using basic IT systems that are required within the role - training can be offered to support this area

It is also important that you share our company values which are at the heart of everything we do and ensure that we deliver high quality, consistent care and support.

As part of the selection process you will have an opportunity to meet the people you will be supporting in their work environment. This will allow you to see first-hand their wonderful personalities and fully understand the level of care and support that is required.

Working for Us

In return, we offer you a rewarding role with the opportunity to develop your skills and future career in a rewarding and enriching environment.

Community Integrated Care is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

We would ideally like the successful candidates to have previously worked in a hotel environment, however this is not essential, as full training will be given.

Job Purpose

To manage the effective operation of the housekeeping department, ensuring that all company standards of quality and cleanliness are maintained at all times whilst meeting the needs of the business.

Main Responsibilities/Key Tasks

  • To ensure that your team are developed to deliver the brand standards outlined in the hotel operating manual.
  • To display a pro-active and innovative approach to skill development and enhancement in your team.
  • Ensure communication procedures are effective and efficient on a day to day basis so that customer service standards are not compromised.
  • Co-ordinate constructively with both reception and reservations so that the day to day operational requirements are successfully delivered.
  • Establish and maintain strict security procedures within your department, especially areas relating to key control, bedroom access and vigilance of the team.

  • To ensure that a high standard of cleanliness is maintained and monitored throughout the hotel incorporating bedroom corridors and all public and B.O.H areas.
  • To have a full understanding of the Guest Line front office system enabling suitable control of all bed stock and guest movements.
  • To attend and contribute to all daily/weekly team meetings.
  • To effectively administer and plan rostas, timesheets, lieu time and holidays.
  • To be fully conversant with disciplinary procedures and all other relevant human resources practices e.g. sickness/absenteeism.
  • To ensure each new member of the team receives a departmental induction within their first week and that they attend a company orientation within their first four weeks of employment.
  • To carry out appraisals/job chats as per the company appraisal system.
  • Ensuring recruitment, training, development and staffing levels are as required, whilst demonstrating a management style that is both ‘hands on’ and strategic.
